repnme.cdata!:
Madagascar - Second Private Sector
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Private Sector
            Development Project for Madagascar were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately unsatisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            securing government ownership and commitment are paramount
            and can never be underestimated. While the project was
            substantially restructured to better reflect the priorities
            of the new government's priorities in 2002, it did not
            go far enough to reengage the new administration to the
            extent necessary to privatize all companies or empower
            autonomous 28 regulatory agencies. In least developed
            countries with weak government capacity, simplicity and
            prioritization are essential in project design. The
            development of filters that capture political economy risks
            in project design, and redesign, will be particularly useful
            to assess realistic outcomes. Key appointments must be made
            on a meritocratic basis and not through discretionary
            appointments. Successful privatization is particularly
            closely linked to establishing a constituency for reform at
            the political level.

repnme.cdata!:
Madagascar - Second Private Sector
            Development Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The report is an environmental audit of
            four public enterprises in Madagascar to be privatized under
            the second Private Sector Development Project. Environmental
            concerns focus primarily on the widespread erosion in the
            country, caused in part by the indiscriminate burning of
            trees, and crops along riverbanks, thus sedimentation in
            lakes, and rivers have increased tremendously, threatening
            the environment with potential desertification. The
            environmental criteria rates the components for evaluating,
            and characterizing the audit of a site according to the type
            of enterprise, emissions and air quality, wastewater
            (surface and groundwater receptors), wastes and oil spills,
            noise disturbances, health and safety issues, and, the
            environmental management regulatory framework.
            Recommendations include: clinical evaluation of water borne,
            and related diseases, and assessment of water and
            sanitation, through laboratory analysis; planning
            formulation for settlements surrounding reservoirs, to
            include sanitation facilities, and awareness campaigns on
            health practices; solid wastes should be collected for
            disposal at selected dump sites, and, an evaluation of
            current sewage and water supply systems implemented;
            decommissioning plans should address dismantling, removal,
            and safe disposal of obsolete plants, and equipment, in
            accordance with Bank environmental guidelines.

repnme.cdata!:
Africa - Regional Trade Facilitation
            Project : restructuring of development credits for Uganda,
            Tanzania, Kenya, Zambia, Malawi, Burundi, Rwanda, Congo and Madagascar

abstracts.cdata!:
While performance of the regional trade
            facilitation project for Africa is satisfactory, the project
            has fallen short of its potential due to the restrictive
            capital structure of the Africa Trade Insurance Agency (ATI)
            and a misalignment of products offered by ATI with market
            requirements. Three changes are proposed: (i) capital
            restructuring of ATI; (ii) expansion of product lines
            offered; and (iii) consolidation of the existing individual
            IDA projects under a single project number. These
            modifications (i and ii) will help solidify ATI's
            capacity to deliver on its mandate to facilitate productive
            trade and investment for member states while the third
            proposed change (iii) will realign World Bank processes to
            ensure a regional approach to development.

repnme.cdata!:
Madagascar - Second Private Sector
            Development Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The report is an environmental audit of
            four public enterprises in Madagascar to be privatized under
            the second Private Sector Development Project. Environmental
            concerns focus primarily on the widespread erosion in the
            country, caused in part by the indiscriminate burning of
            trees, and crops along riverbanks, thus sedimentation in
            lakes, and rivers have increased tremendously, threatening
            the environment with potential desertification. The
            environmental criteria rates the components for evaluating,
            and characterizing the audit of a site according to the type
            of enterprise, emissions and air quality, wastewater
            (surface and groundwater receptors), wastes and oil spills,
            noise disturbances, health and safety issues, and, the
            environmental management regulatory framework.
            Recommendations include: clinical evaluation of water borne,
            and related diseases, and assessment of water and
            sanitation, through laboratory analysis; planning
            formulation for settlements surrounding reservoirs, to
            include sanitation facilities, and awareness campaigns on
            health practices; solid wastes should be collected for
            disposal at selected dump sites, and, an evaluation of
            current sewage and water supply systems implemented;
            decommissioning plans should address dismantling, removal,
            and safe disposal of obsolete plants, and equipment, in
            accordance with Bank environmental guidelines.

repnme.cdata!:
Madagascar - Second Private Sector
            Development Project : proposed amendment to the Development
            Credit Agreement

abstracts.cdata!:
The Government has proposed that the
            savings of the Second Private Sector Development Project be
            utilized to finance the following two additional components:
            a) Madagascar's initial contribution to, and
            participation in the Insurance Facility managed by the
            African Trade Insurance Agency (ATI), and, b) Technical
            Assistance Facility for small and medium scale enterprises
            (SMEs), in cooperation with the International Finance
            Corporation (IFC). The Government has requested the increase
            in the thresholds for the procurement of goods, works and
            services. The Project has a satisfactory rating, and, the
            additional activities are of a high priority, being fully
            consistent with the Project's original objectives,
            activities which will further facilitate the entry of new
            participants. It is recommended the amendments proposed
            herewith be approved.
